ADT

Class DefaultCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstraction.ACharacter
      • ADT.DefaultCharacter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILookable, IPrototype, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DefaultCharacter
extends ACharacter
    Class used to make an implementation of a default ACharacter
    Author:
    Fabricio Ceciliano, Carlos Esquivel, Marco Gamboa, Diego Murillo
    See Also:
    ACharacter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DefaultCharacter.DefaultCharacterBuilder
      Inner class used to implements the Builder and creates a new Default Character.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultCharacter

        public DefaultCharacter()
        Creates a default character with the default information from its parent.

      • DefaultCharacter

        public DefaultCharacter(java.lang.String name,
                        java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,AAppearance> appearance,
                        int currentHealthPoints,
                        int maxHealthPoints,
                        int hitsPerUnit,
                        int level,
                        int tiles,
                        int unlockLevel,
                        int cost,
                        java.util.ArrayList<AWeapon> weapons,
                        int coordinateX,
                        int coordinateY)
        Creates a character with the specified information.
        Parameters:
        name - Character's name.
        appearance - Character's TreeMap containing the level and the corresponding string list of appearances.
        currentHealthPoints - Character's current health points.
        maxHealthPoints - Character's max health points.
        hitsPerUnit - Character's hits per unit of time value.
        level - Character's level.
        tiles - Character's spaciousness in a space unit.
        unlockLevel - Character's unlock level.
        cost - Character's cost.
        weapons - Character's arraylist containing it's weapons.
        coordinateX - Character's X coordinate used in a space unit.
        coordinateY - Character's Y coordinate used in a space unit.

      • useWeapon

        public void useWeapon(int index,
                      ACharacter character)
               throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Method used to employ in a Character a AWeapon from a specific index.
        Specified by:
        useWeapon in class ACharacter
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the weapon in the character's weapons arraylist.
        character - The character who is going to be affected by the weapon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is not in the weapons list bounds.
